thread.title_full: Woman's body found Karen Ristevski Mt Macedon Melbourne | Daily Mail Online

author: Rachel Eddie
title: Woman's body found Karen Ristevski Mt Macedon Melbourne | Daily Mail Online
text: 'What did you do with the body?' Chilling joke from a witness after seeing a man with a shovel where a woman's body was found - as Karen Ristevski's family prepare for the worst A 'badly decomposing' body was found in bushland on Monday afternoon Karen Ristevski's family have been told the body could be the missing mother Bushwalker found the body under a large log in Mt Macedon, north of Melbourne Witness says he saw a man with a shovel at the scene an unknown period earlier Published: 20:26 GMT, 20 February 2017 | Updated: 22:16 GMT, 20 February 2017 40 shares comments A bushwalker saw a man with a shovel where a woman's body has been unearthed under a log near the search for missing mother Karen Ristevski. A witness on Monday told police he had seen a man with a shovel an unknown period before a woman's body was found at Mt Macedon, northwest of Melbourne. The witness said he had joked to the man with a shovel, 'What did you do to the body?' He said the man responded with an expressionless face, Herald Sun reported. Police at the scene where a 'badly decomposed' body was found in Mount Macedon, northwest of Melbourne, on Monday afternoon The family of Karen Ristevski (pictured here with husband Borce) has been told a badly decomposing body found in bushland could be the missing mother The body was reportedly found by a bushwalker under a 'large log' Missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski has been missing since June last year. The remains have not yet been identified but her family have been warned the body may be her The family of Karen Ristevski has been told the badly decomposing body could be her, The Australian reported. A bushwalker found the body under a large log and contacted police about 12.30pm on Monday, A Current Affair reported. A friend of Ms Ristevski told The Australian the news has been 'absolutely traumatic' for the family. A Victoria Police spokeswoman said the remains were being taken for forensic tests to determine the identity and the cause of death. The discovery site is about 25 kilometres from the Toolern Vale area where police were searching for Ms Ristevski last December. Police talk to locals near the scene where the body of a woman was found on Monday Police are working to identify the remains of the body found in bushland near a Victorian town The discovery site is about 25 kilometres from the Toolern Vale area where police were searching for missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski last December It is not known if the cases are linked. Ms Ristevski, 47, was last seen on June 29 leaving her home Oakley Drive in Avondale Heights in Melbourne's north-west following an argument with her husband Borce Ristevski. RELATED ARTICLES
